CsGL.OpenGL
Class OpenGLControl

IDisposable, System.Windows.Forms.Control
   |
   +--OpenGLControl
   in OpenGLControl.cs
class OpenGLControl
extends IDisposable, System.Windows.Forms.Control

This an example implementation of OpenGLContext as a control. this "an opengl view" which means you could issue OpenGL command in its glDraw() method (called by default OnPaint() implementation).
The Context is allocated lazily on demand. Therefore it is not, by default, instanciated in the constructor. If you want to init OpenGL there, call Context.Grab() first.

This simple object is not well designed for multithreading. As context could be current in only 1 thread at a time. Yo better design your own widget for multithreaded code.

public OpenGLContext Context;
return the GL context of this windows. create it if needed.

OpenGLControl

Method Detail

CreateContext

protected virtual OpenGLContext CreateContext();
This method is called whenever the ctxt is needed and not yet initialized. It return a context which draw on the controil and call InitGLContext on it

Dispose

protected override void Dispose( bool disposing );

DisposeContext

protected virtual void DisposeContext();
This method destroy the current OpenGLContext. Which would be automatically recreated when needed

glDraw

public virtual void glDraw();
the main drawing method. OnPaint prepare context and such stuff. override this to draw..

GrabContext

public void GrabContext();
make this control's OpenGL context the current context for this thread.

InitGLContext

protected virtual void InitGLContext();
this method is to be called each time a GL context is created. for example at the creation of the Control, before printing, etc..

OnPaint

protected override void OnPaint( PaintEventArgs pevent );
prepare OpenGL for rendering on this window by grabbing context and call glDraw. override glDraw to do gl operation.

this method Grab() the control context.

OnPaintBackground

protected override void OnPaintBackground( PaintEventArgs pevent );
do nothing => avoid flashing. anyway ControlStyles.AllPaintingInWmPaint is set

OnSizeChanged

protected override void OnSizeChanged( EventArgs e );
set glViewport. subclass to set frustrum...

RecreateContext

public virtual void RecreateContext();
just here for backward compatibility. merely dispose the context

SwapBuffer

protected virtual void SwapBuffer();
call it to SwapBuffer if you are double buffered. it is also a good idea to do it before doing standart gdi drawing if you want to use this feature.
